articles.title: Whitey Bulger mugshot comes down at Savin Hill restaurant after backlash
articles.description:
Savin Bar and Kitchen had received criticism and made national headlines over hanging up the mugshots of two Boston mobsters.

The post Whitey Bulger mugshot comes down at Savin Hill restaurant after backlash appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Savin Bar and Kitchen removed Whitey Bulger's mugshot following community backlash.
The restaurant faced criticism for displaying mugshots of two notorious Boston mobsters.
Local residents expressed concerns over glorifying criminal figures in their neighborhood.

articles.title: Have you seen snowliage — that wild mix of fall leaves and winter snow?
articles.description:
It's when Mother Nature presents a mixture of snow and foliage.

The post Have you seen snowliage — that wild mix of fall leaves and winter snow? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston residents are witnessing 'snowliage' as fall leaves mix with winter snow.
This phenomenon is particularly visible in parks like Boston Common and the Arnold Arboretum.
Local photographers are capturing unique winter scenes, boosting community engagement and tourism.

articles.title: Lynn man convicted of killing girlfriend whose body was found in Saugus marsh
articles.description:
“Our hope is that the family and friends of Sherell Pringle can find some comfort in this outcome,” Essex DA Paul Tucker said.

The post Lynn man convicted of killing girlfriend whose body was found in Saugus marsh appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lynn man convicted of murdering Sherell Pringle, found in Saugus marsh.
Essex DA Paul Tucker expressed hope for Pringle's family after the verdict.
The conviction highlights ongoing concerns about domestic violence in Boston area.

articles.title: Debt holders take over downtown Boston office building sold below value
articles.description:
The City of Boston lost its bid for the $19 million building, saying it hoped to convert it into housing.

The post Debt holders take over downtown Boston office building sold below value appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Debt holders acquired a downtown Boston office building sold for $19 million below market value.
The City of Boston aimed to convert the building into housing but lost the bid.
This sale may hinder local housing development efforts in downtown Boston.
